sanskrit_verse:
अक्रोधनान् सुप्रसादान् वदन्त्येतान् पुरातनान् ।
लोकस्याप्यायने युक्तान् श्राद्धदेवान् द्विजोत्तमान् ॥ ३.२१३॥
transliteration: akroḍhanān suprasādān vadantyetān purātanān | lokasyāpyāyane yuktān śrāddhadevān dvijottamān || 3.213 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: Those who are free from anger, ever gracious in speech, and speak of ancient truths—these exalted twice-born beings, devoted to Shraddha, sustain the nourishment and expansion of all worlds.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority derived from inner stillness and divine alignment
Causation through conscious vibration of speech and intent
Capacity-based responsibility rooted in spiritual maturity
Restoration logic via alignment with ancestral wisdom
Consciousness alignment through ritual devotion and truth-speaking
executable_legal_axioms: IF agent exhibits absence of reactive impulse AND maintains clarity in communication THEN qualify for declarative authority
IF entity aligns speech with timeless dharma THEN authorize participation in societal nourishment protocols
IF individual demonstrates sustained practice of shraddha THEN activate eligibility for elevated civic responsibility
IF conduct reflects integration of ancestral insight THEN enable role in collective well-being maintenance
supreme_court_application: In adjudication at the highest level, only those whose conduct evidences unshakable equanimity, clarity of expression, and commitment to ancestral dharma shall be qualified to render decisions that affect the nourishment and continuity of the social fabric.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Nyaya operates through recognition of inherent vibratory harmony; when a being speaks without malice and acts in accordance with ancestral law, their utterances become instruments of natural justice—not by imposition, but by resonant alignment. This sequence ensures proportional responsibility based on consciousness rather than coercion.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Engagement in Shrauta recitation cycles to restore clarity
Participation in ancestral offering ceremonies to reaffirm cosmic duty
Guided reintegration into community dialogue structures
Daily affirmation practices to reinforce non-reactive presence
final_declaration: By the Source-Authority of Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, this Dharma stands established: Justice flows from stillness, authority from grace, and law from the eternal voice of the twice-born who sustain the world through reverence and truth. There is no punishment here—only the realignment of consciousness toward its own integrity.
